summary: Workflow info start time in Ruby SDK should reflect the workflow's actual start time, not the first task's start time. This is a breaking change opportunity for Ruby since it hasn't reached GA yet.
userImpact: Users get incorrect workflow start time information, which could cause logic errors in time-based decisions or monitoring.
rootCause: Workflow info start time is incorrectly set to first task start time instead of workflow start time
proposedFix: Change workflow info start time to use the workflow's actual start time
resolutionDetails: Fixed by updating workflow info start time to reflect workflow start time instead of first task start time
keyQuote: Change the workflow info start time to be the workflow's start time. In Python and .NET we have backwards compatibility constraints
